intro: Macleania mollis, commonly known as the silky waxplant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its dense, waxy, silver-green foliage that gives it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink, which bloom in clusters. Macleania mollis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained soil.
